slides.title: Welcome to SAP Integration
slides.content:
# SAP Integration Concepts

SAP's power lies in its **integrated nature** - all modules work together seamlessly to provide a unified view of business operations.

## What You Will Learn

- **MM-FI-CO Integration** - Procurement to finance
- **SD-FI Integration** - Sales to finance
- **Cross-Module Reporting** - Unified analytics
- **End-to-End Processes** - Complete business cycles

## Why Integration Matters

| Benefit | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| Single Entry | Enter once, update everywhere |
| Real-Time | Immediate financial impact |
| Accuracy | No manual reconciliation |
| Visibility | Complete business view |

## SAP Module Integration Map

```
       +------+
       |  SD  |---+
       +------+   |
          |       |
       +------+   |    +------+
       |  MM  |---+--->|  FI  |
       +------+   |    +------+
          |       |       |
       +------+   |    +------+
       |  PP  |---+    |  CO  |
       +------+        +------+
```

> **Integration eliminates silos** and ensures data consistency!

slides.title: Procure to Pay Process
slides.content:
# Procure to Pay (P2P) Integration

## End-to-End Process

```
Purchase Req --> PO --> GR --> Invoice --> Payment
   (MM)        (MM)   (MM)    (MM/FI)     (FI)
```

## Step-by-Step Integration

### 1. Purchase Requisition (ME51N)
- Internal request for material
- No FI impact yet
- Can trigger MRP

### 2. Purchase Order (ME21N)
- Commitment to vendor
- CO: Commitment posting (optional)
- No FI impact yet

### 3. Goods Receipt (MIGO)
```
MM: Stock increased
FI: Dr: Inventory
    Cr: GR/IR Account
CO: Cost center if consumed
```

### 4. Invoice Verification (MIRO)
```
MM: Invoice matched to GR/PO
FI: Dr: GR/IR Account
    Cr: Vendor (AP)
    Dr: Tax Account
```

### 5. Payment (F110)
```
FI: Dr: Vendor Account
    Cr: Bank Account
```

## Complete Journal Flow

| Step | Debit | Credit |
|------|-------|--------|
| GR | Inventory | GR/IR |
| Invoice | GR/IR, Tax | Vendor |
| Payment | Vendor | Bank |

> **P2P automation** reduces manual intervention!

slides.title: Order to Cash Process
slides.content:
# Order to Cash (O2C) Integration

## End-to-End Process

```
Sales Order --> Delivery --> Billing --> Payment
    (SD)          (SD)        (SD/FI)     (FI)
```

## Step-by-Step Integration

### 1. Sales Order (VA01)
- Customer order received
- Availability check (MM integration)
- Credit check (FI integration)
- CO: Sales order costing

### 2. Delivery (VL01N)
```
SD: Outbound delivery created
MM: Goods issue posted
    Dr: COGS
    Cr: Inventory
```

### 3. Billing (VF01)
```
SD: Invoice created
FI: Dr: Customer (AR)
    Cr: Revenue
    Cr: Tax
CO-PA: Profitability analysis
```

### 4. Payment Receipt (F-28)
```
FI: Dr: Bank
    Cr: Customer
```

## CO-PA Integration

```
Billing Document
      |
      v
CO-PA Posting:
  Revenue: $10,000
  COGS: ($6,000)
  Contribution: $4,000
  
Characteristics:
  Customer, Product, Region
```

> **O2C integration** ensures accurate revenue recognition!

slides.title: MM-FI Integration Details
slides.content:
# MM-FI Integration

## Automatic Account Determination

### Configuration

```
SPRO > MM > Valuation and Account Assignment >
  Account Determination > Account Determination Wizard
```

### Key Elements

| Element | Purpose |
|---------|--------|
| Valuation Class | Groups materials for accounting |
| Transaction Key | Movement type to account link |
| Account | GL account to post |

## Transaction Keys

| Key | Description | Movement |
|-----|-------------|----------|
| BSX | Inventory posting | Stock change |
| GBB | Offsetting entry | Cost of goods |
| PRD | Price difference | Variance |
| WRX | GR/IR clearing | Invoice matching |

## Example: Goods Receipt

```
Movement Type: 101 (GR from PO)

Account Determination:
  BSX --> Inventory Account (3000)
  WRX --> GR/IR Account (1910)

Posting:
  Dr: 3000 Inventory    $10,000
  Cr: 1910 GR/IR        $10,000
```

## Valuation Classes

| Class | Material Type | Inventory Account |
|-------|---------------|-------------------|
| 3000 | Raw Material | 300000 |
| 3100 | Semi-Finished | 310000 |
| 7920 | Finished Goods | 320000 |

> **Correct configuration** ensures accurate financials!

slides.title: SD-FI Integration Details
slides.content:
# SD-FI Integration

## Billing to Accounting Flow

```
SD Billing Document (VF01)
          |
          v
Account Determination
          |
          v
FI Document Created
          |
          v
CO-PA Document (if configured)
```

## Account Assignment in SD

### Key Factors

| Element | From |
|---------|------|
| Customer Account | Customer Master |
| Revenue Account | Condition Type |
| Tax Account | Tax Code |
| Reconciliation Account | Customer Master |

### Revenue Account Determination

```
Chart of Accounts + 
Sales Organization + 
Account Assignment Group (Customer) + 
Account Assignment Group (Material) + 
Account Key
= Revenue Account
```

## Example: Sales Invoice

```
Billing: $11,000 (including 10% tax)

FI Posting:
  Dr: Customer (AR)    $11,000
  Cr: Revenue          $10,000
  Cr: Output Tax        $1,000

CO-PA:
  Revenue: $10,000
  Customer: ABC Corp
  Product: Widget A
  Region: North
```

## Credit Management Integration

```
Sales Order (VA01)
      |
      v
Credit Check (FI)
      |
      v
Approved? --> Process
      |
      v (No)
Blocked for Credit
```

> **SD-FI integration** enables accurate revenue reporting!

slides.title: MM-CO Integration
slides.content:
# MM-CO Integration

## Cost Assignment in Procurement

### Cost Object Types

| Object | Use Case |
|--------|----------|
| Cost Center | Department expense |
| Internal Order | Project/event |
| WBS Element | Large project |
| Network | Complex project |

## Direct Procurement to Cost Center

```
Purchase Order with Account Assignment:
  Account: Cost Center 1000
  
Goods Receipt:
  Dr: Expense Account    $500
  Cr: GR/IR              $500
  CO: Cost Center 1000   $500
```

## Indirect Material to Cost Center

```
Goods Issue (201):
  From: Warehouse Stock
  To: Cost Center 1000

Posting:
  Dr: Expense            $500
  Cr: Inventory          $500
  CO: Cost Center 1000   $500
```

## Activity Type Consumption

```
Production Order:
  Material: RAW-001
  Labor: 2 hours @ $25/hr
  Machine: 1 hour @ $50/hr

CO Posting:
  Material: $100 (Cost Element)
  Labor: $50 (Activity Type)
  Machine: $50 (Activity Type)
```

## Key Integration Points

| MM Transaction | CO Object |
|----------------|----------|
| GI to Cost Center | Expense posting |
| GI to Order | Order cost |
| GI to Production | WIP |

> **MM-CO integration** provides complete cost visibility!

slides.title: Production-Finance Integration
slides.content:
# PP Integration with FI/CO

## Production Order Flow

```
Planned Order (MRP)
        |
        v
Production Order (CO01)
        |
        v
Material Issue (MIGO)
        |
        v
Confirmation (CO11N)
        |
        v
Goods Receipt (MIGO)
        |
        v
Order Settlement (KO88)
```

## Cost Flow in Production

### Material Consumption (261)
```
FI: Dr: WIP (Work in Process)
    Cr: Inventory
CO: Production Order: $500 (Material)
```

### Activity Confirmation
```
CO: Production Order:
    Labor: $100 (Activity)
    Machine: $50 (Activity)
```

### Finished Goods Receipt (101)
```
FI: Dr: FG Inventory
    Cr: WIP
CO: Production Order Credit
```

### Settlement (KO88)
```
Variance Analysis:
  Standard Cost: $650
  Actual Cost: $680
  Variance: $30 (Unfavorable)

Settlement:
  Dr: Variance Account    $30
  Cr: Production Order    $30
```

## Variance Categories

| Type | Cause |
|------|-------|
| Price | Material price difference |
| Quantity | Usage variance |
| Scrap | Material waste |
| Efficiency | Labor/machine variance |

> **Production integration** enables accurate product costing!

slides.title: HR-FI Integration
slides.content:
# HR-FI Payroll Integration

## Payroll to Finance Flow

```
Time Recording
      |
      v
Payroll Run (PC00_M99_CALC)
      |
      v
Remuneration Statement
      |
      v
Posting to FI (PC00_M99_CIPE)
```

## Payroll Posting

### Example Payroll

```
Employee: John Smith
Cost Center: 1000 (IT Department)

Gross Salary:     $5,000
Tax Withholding:   ($750)
Social Security:   ($310)
Net Pay:          $3,940
```

### FI Posting

```
Dr: Salary Expense     $5,000  (Cost Center 1000)
Cr: Tax Payable          $750
Cr: SS Payable           $310
Cr: Salaries Payable   $3,940
```

## Cost Distribution

```
Employee works on multiple cost centers:
  IT (1000): 60%
  Sales (2000): 40%

Salary: $5,000
  Cost Center 1000: $3,000
  Cost Center 2000: $2,000
```

## Integration Points

| HR Element | FI/CO Impact |
|------------|-------------|
| Employee Master | Cost center assignment |
| Wage Types | Cost element mapping |
| Payroll Results | FI document creation |
| Time Recording | Activity confirmation |

> **HR-FI integration** ensures accurate personnel costs!

slides.title: Asset Integration
slides.content:
# Asset Accounting Integration

## Asset Acquisition from MM

### PO for Capital Asset

```
Purchase Order (ME21N):
  Account Assignment: A (Asset)
  Asset Number: 100001
  Amount: $50,000
```

### Goods Receipt

```
MIGO:
  Movement Type: 101
  Account Assignment: Asset

FI Posting:
  Dr: Asset Under Construction  $50,000
  Cr: GR/IR Clearing            $50,000
```

## Asset Capitalization

### From Internal Order

```
Investment Order: 500001
Collected Costs: $75,000

Settlement (KO88):
  Settlement Receiver: Asset 100002

Posting:
  Dr: Asset                $75,000
  Cr: Asset Under Const.   $75,000
```

## Depreciation Posting

```
Monthly Depreciation Run (AFAB):

Asset: 100002
Depreciation: $1,250/month

Posting:
  Dr: Depreciation Expense  $1,250
  Cr: Accum. Depreciation   $1,250

CO: Cost Center 1000        $1,250
```

## Asset Retirement

```
Sale of Asset (ABAON):
  Book Value: $40,000
  Sale Price: $45,000

Posting:
  Dr: Bank                   $45,000
  Dr: Accum. Depreciation    $35,000
  Cr: Asset                  $75,000
  Cr: Gain on Sale            $5,000
```

> **Asset integration** tracks the complete fixed asset lifecycle!

slides.title: Cross-Module Document Flow
slides.content:
# Document Flow Analysis

## What is Document Flow?

A visual representation of all documents created throughout a business process.

## Example: Sales Order Flow

```
Sales Order (SO): 10001
        |
        v
Delivery (DN): 80001
        |
        v
Goods Issue: 4900000001
        |
        v
Billing Document: 90001
        |
        v
FI Document: 1000000001
        |
        v
CO-PA Document: 1234567
```

## Viewing Document Flow

### Transaction: VA03 (Display Sales Order)

```
Environment > Display Document Flow

Result:
+--------------------------------+
| Sales Order     | 10001       |
|   Delivery      | 80001       |
|     Goods Issue | 4900000001  |
|   Billing       | 90001       |
|     Acctg Doc   | 1000000001  |
+--------------------------------+
```

## Key Document Flow Transactions

| Start From | Display TCode |
|------------|---------------|
| Sales Order | VA03 |
| Delivery | VL03N |
| Billing | VF03 |
| Purchase Order | ME23N |
| Goods Movement | MB03 |
| FI Document | FB03 |

## Why Document Flow Matters

- Trace transaction history
- Troubleshoot issues
- Audit trail
- Process verification

> **Document flow provides complete visibility** into business transactions!

slides.title: Reconciliation Across Modules
slides.content:
# Cross-Module Reconciliation

## Why Reconcile?

- Verify data integrity
- Identify discrepancies
- Ensure accurate reporting
- Meet audit requirements

## Key Reconciliation Points

### MM vs FI Inventory

```
MM Stock Value (MB5L):  $500,000
FI Inventory GL (FAGLB03): $500,000
                        ---------
Difference:                    $0
```

### GR/IR Clearing

```
Open GR (without Invoice): $50,000
Open IR (without GR):      $10,000

Expected GR/IR Balance:   ($40,000)
Actual GR/IR Balance:     ($40,000)
Difference:                     $0
```

### AP Subledger vs GL

```
AP Subledger (FBL1N):  $200,000
AP Control GL:         $200,000
                      ---------
Difference:                  $0
```

## Reconciliation Reports

| Check | Report/TCode |
|-------|-------------|
| MM to FI Stock | MB5L vs FS10N |
| GR/IR Balance | MB5S |
| AP Reconciliation | F.44 |
| AR Reconciliation | F.25 |
| FI to CO | KALC |

## Common Discrepancy Causes

| Issue | Cause |
|-------|-------|
| Stock mismatch | Unposted movements |
| GR/IR difference | Missing invoices |
| Subledger gap | Direct GL posting |

> **Regular reconciliation** ensures system integrity!

slides.title: Intercompany Transactions
slides.content:
# Intercompany Processing

## What is Intercompany?

Transactions between **different company codes** within the same SAP system.

## Intercompany Stock Transfer

```
Company 1000 (Seller) --> Company 2000 (Buyer)

MM Posting:
  1000: Cr: Intercompany Inventory
  2000: Dr: Inventory

FI Posting:
  1000: Dr: Intercompany Receivable
  2000: Cr: Intercompany Payable
```

## Intercompany Sales

```
External Customer Order to Company 1000
Fulfilled by Company 2000

Company 2000 (Supplier):
  Sales to Company 1000
  Creates Intercompany Invoice

Company 1000 (Face to Customer):
  Sales to External Customer
  Records AP to Company 2000
```

## Intercompany Clearing

```
Automatic Clearing at Period End:

  Company 1000 Receivable from 2000: $50,000
  Company 2000 Payable to 1000:      $50,000

  Result: Both cleared
```

## Configuration

```
SPRO > Financial Accounting > 
  Accounts Receivable/Payable >
    Business Transactions >
      Intercompany Postings
```

## Key Considerations

| Aspect | Requirement |
|--------|------------|
| Transfer Pricing | Arm's length prices |
| Currency | Conversion handling |
| Elimination | Consolidation entries |
| Documentation | Audit trail |

> **Intercompany integration** supports multi-entity operations!

slides.title: Period-End Integration
slides.content:
# Integrated Period-End Closing

## Closing Sequence

### Correct Order Matters!

```
1. Complete MM activities
   - Post final GR/IR
   - Close MM period (MMPV)

2. Complete SD billing
   - Final billing documents
   - Revenue recognition

3. Complete PP activities
   - Production confirmations
   - Order settlements

4. CO closing activities
   - Allocations
   - Assessments
   - Order settlement

5. FI closing activities
   - Depreciation (AFAB)
   - Accruals
   - Currency revaluation
   - Period close (OB52)
```

## Integration Dependencies

```
MM Period Close
      |
      v (required before)
FI Period Close
      |
      v (required before)
CO Settlement
```

## Cross-Module Closing Checklist

| Module | Key Activity | TCode |
|--------|--------------|-------|
| MM | GR/IR Clearing | MB5S |
| MM | Period Close | MMPV |
| PP | Order Settlement | CO88 |
| CO | Allocations | KSU5 |
| CO | Order Settlement | KO88 |
| AA | Depreciation | AFAB |
| FI | Period Close | OB52 |

> **Coordinated closing** ensures accurate financial reporting!

slides.title: Integration Troubleshooting
slides.content:
# Common Integration Issues

## Problem: Missing FI Document

### Symptoms
- MM document posted
- No corresponding FI document

### Causes
- Account determination missing
- GL account blocked
- Posting period closed

### Resolution
```
1. Check account determination (OBYC)
2. Verify GL account status (FS00)
3. Check posting periods (OB52)
4. Review system log (SM21)
```

## Problem: GR/IR Imbalance

### Symptoms
- GR/IR account has balance
- Items should be cleared

### Causes
- Quantity/price differences
- Partial deliveries
- Missing invoices

### Resolution
```
1. Run GR/IR report (MB5S)
2. Identify unmatched items
3. Post missing documents
4. Create adjustment if needed
```

## Problem: CO Not Updated

### Symptoms
- FI posting successful
- CO cost object not updated

### Causes
- Missing cost object assignment
- Cost element not created
- Controlling area issue

### Resolution
```
1. Check cost element (KA03)
2. Verify document (FB03)
3. Check assignment settings
4. Repost if necessary (KB61)
```

## Diagnostic Tools

| Tool | Purpose |
|------|--------|
| SM21 | System log |
| SLG1 | Application log |
| CDHDR | Change documents |
| ST22 | Short dumps |

> **Know your troubleshooting tools** for quick resolution!

slides.title: Best Practices for Integration
slides.content:
# Integration Best Practices

## Master Data Governance

### Consistent Coding

| Element | Best Practice |
|---------|---------------|
| Vendors | Single master across modules |
| Materials | Complete all views |
| GL Accounts | Proper assignment groups |
| Cost Objects | Clear hierarchy |

### Regular Review
- Quarterly master data audit
- Clean up obsolete records
- Validate assignments

## Configuration Standards

### Account Determination
- Document all mappings
- Test in development first
- Validate with finance team
- Version control changes

### Number Ranges
- Sufficient range for growth
- Separate test and production
- Monitor utilization

## Process Discipline

### Posting Timelines
- Same-day posting
- Complete before period close
- No backdating without approval

### Reconciliation Schedule

| Frequency | Activity |
|-----------|----------|
| Daily | Open item review |
| Weekly | Subledger to GL |
| Monthly | Full reconciliation |
| Quarterly | Audit preparation |

## Training and Documentation

- Cross-functional training
- Process documentation
- Error handling procedures
- Escalation paths

> **Discipline and standards** ensure reliable integration!

slides.title: Summary and Key Takeaways
slides.content:
# Congratulations! Summary

You have completed the **SAP Integration** lesson!

## Key Concepts Mastered

### Core Process Integration
- **P2P:** Purchase Req to Payment
- **O2C:** Sales Order to Collection
- **Production:** Raw Material to Finished Goods

### Module Connections
- **MM-FI:** Inventory and GR/IR
- **SD-FI:** Revenue and Receivables
- **PP-CO:** Production Costs
- **HR-FI:** Payroll Expenses

### Cross-Module Activities
- Document flow tracing
- Reconciliation points
- Period-end coordination
- Intercompany transactions

## Integration Flow Summary

```
       MM <--> FI <--> SD
        |       |       |
        v       v       v
       CO <--> PP <--> HR
```

## Quick Reference

| Integration | Key Accounts |
|-------------|-------------|
| GR/IR | Inventory, Clearing |
| Sales | AR, Revenue |
| Production | WIP, FG Inventory |
| Payroll | Expense, Payables |

## What is Next?

Apply this knowledge to:
- Troubleshoot integration issues
- Design new business processes
- Optimize system performance

> **Understanding integration** is key to SAP mastery!
